title: Getting flamed, REACT. -PERMABANNED-
body:
Okay so, I know perma bans are manually checked by riot, I know perma bans are the way of Riot saying GTFO, and I will, don't worry I will keep out of this game, I just wanted to say. First , I  got chat restriction, and its ok, I know I flame sometimes, like everybody does, don't come to me and say you NEVER EVER FLAME, sometimes you get mad because you are trying to tell your team mates something and it doesn't work. 

So here's the thing, recently, I was getting flamed for -winning-   I was told that I was a retard, that I was bronze 6, that I should stop playing this game and all this was said by my support, and I didn't want to tolerate that and I reacted back BUT I WAS STILL winning the game,  the flame kept coming *still managed to win* and then I asked for a report, and even players on the other team decided I was correct and we should report the guy who was flaming me. but surprise, after that game I got perma banned, and its ok, ill accept my perma ban, but I feel with such impotence of getting reported because my support decided to flame me for winning.

I got suspended for 14 days, and managed to relax and said to myself, time to change, and when I come back to game and play my FIRST RANKED game, WIN, and then got perma banned for my support and jungle both decided to report me, even though,the other team agreed that my support was the flamer.

I tried my best on behaving, I reported other players, typed riot my personal opinion, asked politely other people to stop trolling, tolerated trolls, tolerated, flamers, tolerated everything, still got myself banned for trying to contribute to this community.

-How can you not get mad when you trying to make COMPETITIVE GAMEPLAY and get trolled??
-If people don't get the idea of competitive, its that my fault?
-Why should I tolerate someone flaming me and stay quiet?
  that's not ok in ANY community, and not talking about league only, talking in general.

My point of view:
-GETTING REPORTED FOR WINING-
-GETTING PERMA BANNED FOR NOT LETTING MYSELF GET FLAMED-

Thanks for the game riot, you have a great game, not a great system for player behavior IMO, I had a great time learning the game and met great people on this community.

GGWP {{item:3151}}

replies.body:
This is a video game. Not a chatroom. 
You're not supposed to react to chat's negativity. If someone is flaming you, mute them and then play the video game. It's really not all that complex to do. If someone is trolling you, then report them after. The thing is, if you get upset in a competitive game, maybe this competitive game isn't for you. Because this game relies on teamwork. You have to play along with them to win. Because that's all we're trying to do here is win, experience, and enjoy the video game. 

But you choosing to type instead of playing the game, and reacting to negativity and banned for responding to it negatively, well then, now you know, the only thing you're supposed to do here is.. well play the video game. 

Mute. Play. Report. Move on.
Remember, you're either part of the problem or part of the game.
Play the game to be part of the game. Type negatively and be toxic to be part of the problem.

Lets get real, if riot tries to brand league as a sport, then it must act like one, verbal communication is part of the competitive aspect, i know all about how sports are played being a collegiate athlete for multiple years, and riot does it all wrong, esp permanently banning an acct instead of having a permanent chat ban feature which would definitely make the game better or have voice coms, im not here to act nice because theres 12 year olds playing, thats their fault for being online in the first place, where shit happens

You're not playing in the NFL equivalent on league. The standard casual games (including ranked) are not professional games. But the point is moot since in professional sports people have been known to get heavily fined for poor sportsmanship.

ranked isnt casual gaming, its competitive gaming, and theres a completely different environment when you go from casual to competitive, casual gaming is fun and carefree, competitive, you play to win whether you die for your team scream at your team so they get the point or even have to use cursing to get your point across, were not here to have fun in competition, youre there to win

There is no difference between ranked and normal other than a number and the division system. More competitive players like having a number to quantify their skill and effort, but that doesn't make the game mode itself professional in any sense.

You're still expected to follow the rules regardless of the game mode.

Want to get real? You're not playing League as a professional sport. 
This is just another casual player playing a casual ranked game at a very low tier. So whatever you're trying to justify, no one is ever going to buy it. So no, there is no excuse. Regardless.

professional or not it doesnt matter, you arent even justifying any argument of your own, the state of a game is slowly dying and everyone knows riot is doing a bunch of things wrong which is why theres these problems with the community as a whole, and "casual ranked" doesnt exist, theres competitive (ranked) and non competitive (normals/blind) thats why the game modes exist

And you think you are? Please Haha. If anything, you're just making the same comment everyone says when they're banned or don't like justice taking place. It's because you're threatened. And you should be if you think being negative is okay.
As for the game dying? People have been saying that since season one. Nothing has changed.
As for Casual Ranked, it does exist, we play it every day. You cannot justify negative attitudes. Never will either.

yea dude, im EXACTLY the same as everyone else, no im not threatened by anything lol, being negative is part of life, good doesnt exist without bad, and this game literally hasnt become relevant since like season 5, i literally never heard about it until i came into college, it was unknown by everyone from the early seasons except by the few pc gamers who decided to actually get into it, and everyones perceptions of negative attitudes are different, esp passive aggressiveness which never gets punished, but i cant help you understand

If you think being negative is always part of life, then you have some serious issues. Get that checked out. Soon. Everything you're saying is just pure cringed conspiracy theories about how the game is dying with lack of understanding of mutual respect. You're not going to convince anyone, especially as a person who thinks it's okay to ruin someone's day who is trying to use this game as an entertainment. 

No, I won't ever comprehend troubled people with no understanding of respect in a world of an entertainment that is meant to be fun. Games are not supposed to be anything. Games are a medium, like movies, books, and drawing. We don't do these things for the negativity of it. Nobody should ever, ever play a game for entertainment that is not fun, for whatever your definition of fun is. Nothing about fun is supposed to be negative. Your fun isn't more important than everyone else, so you being negative just because it's common to you doesn't mean it's okay.

**Fun is paramount to games when played for entertainment. That leaves no room for negativity, and Riot is working to keep that fun without negativity. **So don't bother replying, because I have nothing else to say to someone who has a problem with respect and enjoy this game as an entertainment. You'll just come with some uncreative insult without understanding the fact that you'll always be in the wrong when you're negative. **Period.** I won't even be reading your next reply because everything you say is absolutely and utterly irrelevant to what this game truly is.
if you dont understand the fact that negativity is part of life, then you need a reality check or to take a philosophy class
Common man.  This game is rated T for teens....

the T actually stands for Tequila

{{sticker:sg-ezreal}}

Damn, how did you not let yourself get flamed? The only way I know of to prevent myself from getting flamed is to mute. What was your method? Because mute will never result in a punishment so you must have used some other strategy.
I don't understand what's "winning" have anything to do with you being punished for flaming.

You really think flaming back and lowering yourself to their level is acceptable or effective?

It just makes you part of the problem. You could mute instead of throwing the game.
I didn't threw, we won.
At least your very last memory on that account is a win.  That's something.
just do what I do MUTE MUTE MUTE
